metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12386 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability in register allocation in JavaScript can lead to type confusion, allowing for an arbitrary read and write. This leads to remote code execution inside the sandboxed content process when triggered. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.2.2 and Firefox < 62.0.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12386` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
